alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bath and northwestern Fleming Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowan, or 7 miles west of Flemingsburg. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flemingsburg, Elizaville, Nepton, Craintown, Pecks Ridge and Tilton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
